ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Phenotype/diagnosis for the subject
Notes: e.g., Healthy, Control, Suicidal

ElementDescription: handedness
Notes: R = Right; L = Left; B = Both; 999= No Answer; 888= Skipped; 777= Condition Skipped; 555= Missing

ElementDescription: Description of experiment/sequence/event
Number of Trials
Trial Duration and Units ie 20 minutes
stimuli description
Mean Reaction Time (ms) when stimulus duration is 1200 milliseconds
Mean Reaction Time (ms) when stimulus duration is 800 milliseconds
Mean Reaction Time (ms) when stimulus duration is 400 milliseconds
Mean Reaction Time (ms) of all trials
Distance between subject and stimulus in millimeters
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data

RTI Five-Choice Error Score (inaccurate): The total number of trials where the subject made an inaccurate response. Calculated across all assessment trials in which the stimulus could appear in any one of five locations.

RTI Five-Choice Error Score (inaccurate): The total number of trials where the subject made an inaccurate response. Calculated across all assessment trials in which the stimulus could appear in any one of five locations.

RTI Five-Choice Error Score (no response): The total number of trials where the subject made no response after the presentation of the target stimulus. Calculated across all assessment trials in which the stimulus could appear in any one of five locations.

RTI Five-Choice Error Score (premature): The total number of trials where the subject made a response before the presentation of the target stimulus. Calculated across all assessment trials in which the stimulus could appear in any one of five locations.

KEY: RTI Median Five-Choice Movement Time: The median time taken for a subject to release the response button and select the target stimulus after it flashed yellow on screen. Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in any one of five locations. Measured in milliseconds.

KEY: RTI Median Five-Choice Reaction Time: The median duration it took for a subject to release the response button after the presentation of a target stimulus. Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in any one of five locations. Measured in milliseconds.

RTI Mean Five-Choice Movement Time: The mean time taken for a subject to release the response button and select the target stimulus after it flashed yellow on screen. Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in any one of five locations. Measured in milliseconds.

RTI Mean Five-Choice Reaction Time: The mean duration it took for a subject to release the response button after the presentation of a target stimulus. Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in any one of five locations. Measured in milliseconds.

RTI Standard Deviation (SD) Five-Choice Movement Time: The standard deviation calculated for the duration it took for a subject to release the response button and select the target stimulus after it flashed yellow on screen.Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in any one of five locations. Measured in milliseconds.

RTI Standard Deviation (SD) Five-Choice Reaction Time: The standard deviation calculated for the duration it took for a subject to release the response button after the presentation of a target stimulus. Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in any one of five locations. Measured in milliseconds.

RTI Simple Error Score (all): The total number of trials where the subject made any form of response error. Calculated across all assessment trials in which the stimulus could appear in one location only.

RTI Simple Error Score (inaccurate): The total number of trials where the subject made an inaccurate response. Calculated across all assessment trials in which the stimulus could appear in one location only.

RTI Simple Error Score (no response): The total number of trials where the subject made no response after the presentation of the target stimulus. Calculated across all assessment trials in which the stimulus could appear in one location only.

RTI Simple Error Score (premature): The total number of trials where the subject made a response before the presentation of the target stimulus. Calculated across all assessment trials in which the stimulus could appear in one location only.

KEY: RTI Simple Median Movement Time: The median time taken for a subject to release the response button and select the target stimulus after it flashed yellow on screen. Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in one location only. Measured in milliseconds.

KEY: RTI Simple Median Reaction Time: The median duration it took for a subject to release the response button after the presentation of a target stimulus. Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in one location only. Measured in milliseconds.

RTI Simple Mean Movement Time: The mean time taken for a subject to release the response button and select the target stimulus after it flashed yellow on screen. Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in one location only. Measured in milliseconds.

RTI Simple Mean Reaction Time: The mean duration it took for a subject to release the response button after the presentation of a target stimulus. Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in one location only. Measured in milliseconds.

RTI Standard Deviation (SD) Simple Movement Time: The standard deviation calculated for the duration it took for a subject to release the response button and select the target stimulus after it flashed yellow on screen.Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in one location only. Measured in milliseconds.

RTI Standard Deviation (SD) Simple Reaction Time: The standard deviation calculated for the duration it took for a subject to release the response button after the presentation of a target stimulus. Calculated across correct, assessed trials in which the stimulus could appear in one location only. Measured in milliseconds.
Site
Notes: Study Site

Notes: 0=Incorrect; 1=Correct

Responded via Keyb/Touch/Mouse
Notes: keyup=Keyboard; mouseup=Mouse (mouseup); pointerup=Mouse (pointerup); timeout=Timed Out; touchend=Touchscreen

Identifier of Current Test

Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

Median reaction time for all trials

device serial number/ID
Seconds Taken To Complete Test

Response Time (ms)
days from enrollment

ElementDescription: The type of stimuli shown
Notes: 1 = Alcohol-related stimuli; 2 = Neutral object-related stimuli

ElementDescription: The type of stimulus/response/outcome mapping used
Notes: 1 = Devalued cue; 2 = Reversed cue; 3 = No change, cue mapping is unchanged throughout experiment

ElementDescription: Block Number
Mean accuracy of participant responses
Notes: 0 = No optimal responses; 1 = All optimal responses

ElementDescription: Mean response time for first response
Notes: Time to open door when making optimal response (ms)

ElementDescription: Mean response time for second response
Notes: Time to go inside room when making optimal response (ms)

ElementDescription: Exact accuracy from contingency task (correct only if only responded to the one correct fruit)
Notes: 0 = Did not remember exact outcome paired with cue; 1 = Remembered exact outcome paired with cue

ElementDescription: Lenient accuracy from contingency task (correct if at least responded to correct fruit)
Notes: 0 = Did not ever indicate correct outcome paired with cue; 1 = Indicated correct outcome paired with cue

ElementDescription: Trial number
Notes: 1 = first; 2= second; 3=third; 4=fourth; 5=fifth; 6=sixth; etc; -777=NA, -999=missing

ElementDescription: Reaction Time
Notes: -1 = NaN
